intro: Viola vespertilionis, commonly known as the evening bat violet, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. Its flowers emit a subtle fragrance, which attracts nocturnal pollinators like moths. Due to habitat loss, Viola vespertilionis is considered endangered in many areas.
